channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024030962
item.description:
Report X-2024030962

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-26T15:10:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: SAGINAW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This was a wet package that came out of unload. The package was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort. DescribePack: The inner containers had loose caps. One cap had a 1 inch crack. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage until it could be processed after the sort.

Report X-2024030873

  • City: SALINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Cap came loose on one bottle of formic acid, causing the contents to leak out. The package was placed in a plastic bin and brought to QA for inspection when damage was discovered. DescribePack: 1 loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bin and brought to QA for inspection when damage was discovered.

item.title: Report X-2024030662
item.description:
Report X-2024030662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO DAMAGE IN SMALL SORT, RESTRICTED AREA. USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS, USED PPE (GOGGLES, GLOVES WITH LINER, BOOTS, APRON , SLEEVES) TEST SPILL WITH PH TAPE PH1, ADDED SODIUM BICARBONATE, PH7, ABSORBED SPILL WITH CLAY ABSORBENT, PLACED DAMAGED PACKAGE IN SPILL TUB. RETURNED TO DMP CAGE FOR PROPER PROCESSING, PROCESSED USING UPS DMP PROCEDURES

item.title: Report X-2024030652
item.description:
Report X-2024030652

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: MADISON HEIGHTS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO EXPIRED HAZ-MAT DISCREPENCY PACKAGE. CONTENTS WAS 12-(1 QT) ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL ALCCOOL ANTISEPTIC. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED WITH PROPER 5 PART FORM (SHIPPING PAPERS), PROPER DIAMOND LABEL FLAMMABLE LIQUID 3, PROPER UN INFORMATION 1219 ISOPROPANOL. THE PACKAGE WAS HELD BY AUDITOR, CONTENTS WAS SHIPPED IN A STANDARD BOX, NO BURST EDGE PROTECTION RATING, AND CORNERS WERE CRUSHED. THE 12- (1 QT) BOTTLES WERE ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORBENT. THE OUTER CARTON WAS THROWN IN THE REGULAR TRASH.

item.title: Report X-2024030620
item.description:
Report X-2024030620

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: HOWELL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: EMPLOYEE HEARD PACKAGE MAKEING A HISSING NOSE. DRIVER NOTIFID A SUPERVISER. RMP BROUGHT BOX TO DMP AND OPEND BOX AND WAS ABLE TO CLOSE THE VALVE. RESPONDER WAS ABLE TO TIGHTEN VALVE, DISCOVERED UNDECLARED.
